SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am16
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am16.server.tcp

Class TCPClientHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am16.server.tcp.TCPClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
RemoteClientInterface, Runnable, Remote
public class TCPClientHandler extends Object implements Runnable, RemoteClientInterface
Class that is used by the server to handle a single client connected via TCP/Socket. This class handles both incoming and outgoing TCP messages to and from the client which it is handling.

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPClientHandler

      public TCPClientHandler(Socket clientSocket, LobbyManager lobbyManager) throws IOException
      Constructs a new TCP client handler for a specific client.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - The socket through which the client and server will exchange messages.
      lobbyManager - The lobby manager that contains information about active games.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown if an error occurs while creating input and output streams for the socket.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the client handler, and sets it up to receive and send messages to the client. Also starts a ping routine to check that the connection between client and server is always active.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • pingRoutine

      private void pingRoutine()
      Starts a routine that sends the client a ping message every 10 seconds. If the client does not respond to a ping message in the time between one ping and the other, the client is considered disconnected and the connection is closed.

    • sendTCPMessage

      private void sendTCPMessage(TCPMessage tcpMessage)
      Sends the given message to the client through the open socket in this handler.
      Parameters:
      tcpMessage - The message to be sent.

    • notifyGames

      public void notifyGames(Set<String> gameIds, Map<String,Integer> currentPlayers, Map<String,Integer> maxPlayers, Map<String,LobbyState> lobbyStates) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Show the existing game IDs to the player.
      Specified by:
      notifyGames in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      gameIds - The existing games' IDs.
      currentPlayers - The number of current players for each game
      maxPlayers - The maximum number of players for each game
      lobbyStates - The state of the lobby for each game
      Throws:
      RemoteException - thrown if an error occurs during Java RMI communication.

    • setPlayArea

      public void setPlayArea(String username, List<Position> cardPlacementOrder, Map<Position,BoardCard> field, Map<BoardCard,SideType> activeSides, Set<Position> legalPositions, Set<Position> illegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts)
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Sets the given player's play area.
      Specified by:
      setPlayArea in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The player whose play area is being given.
      cardPlacementOrder - The order in which the cards were played in this play area.
      field - The user's field.
      activeSides - The map keeping track of which side every card is placed on.
      legalPositions - The set of positions on which the player can place cards.
      illegalPositions - The set of positions on which the player must not place cards.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource that the player has.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object that the player has.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(String username, BoardCard card, SideType side, Position pos, Set<Position> addedLegalPositions, Set<Position> removedLegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts)
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Adds the given card to the given player's play area.
      Specified by:
      playCard in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player who played the card.
      card - The played card.
      side - The card the new card was played on.
      pos - The position where the new card was played.
      addedLegalPositions - The set of new positions in which the player can play a card, following the move which was just made.
      removedLegalPositions - The set of positions in which the player can no longer play a card, following the move which was just made.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource that the player has, following the move which was just made.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object that the player has, following the move which was just made.

    • signalDisconnection

      public void signalDisconnection(String whoDisconnected)
      Description copied from interface: RemoteClientInterface
      Tells the client that another client has disconnected. This ends the game, if it had started. If the game hadn't started already, the player is simply removed.
      Specified by:
      signalDisconnection in interface RemoteClientInterface
      Parameters:
      whoDisconnected - The username of the player who disconnected.
